SEARCH
Package fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.irirefs.manager.normalizer

Interface INormalizer

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicNormalizer
public interface INormalizer
Strategy interface for IRIRef normalization.

An INormalizer defines how IRIRef instances should be normalized before storage, comparison, or stringification. It abstracts over different normalization strategies (syntax-based, scheme-based, path simplification, etc.) and enables pluggable behavior in IRIManager-like components.

A typical implementation normalizes an IRIRef in place using one or more calls to IRIRef.normalizeInPlace(NORMALIZATION) and returns the modified instance for potential chaining.

Use Case

This interface is designed to support modular IRI resolution frameworks, allowing different applications (e.g., semantic web, DLGP, RDF parsers) to define their own normalization policies. It is especially useful when you want to:
  • Standardize IRI comparisons
  • Ensure consistent formatting of stored or displayed IRIs
  • Enforce RFC-compliant simplification of paths, schemes, ports, etc.

Implementing Classes

Classes implementing INormalizer should document their strategy clearly and ensure that normalization only applies to resolved IRIs unless explicitly safe to do otherwise.
See Also:
  • IRIRef
  • IRIRef.normalizeInPlace(NORMALIZATION)

    IRIRef

  • Method Details

    • normalize

      IRIRef normalize(IRIRef iriref) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Defines the contract for normalizing IRIRef objects.

      Implementations are expected to apply one or more normalization strategies (e.g., syntax, scheme-based, path segment simplification) to make IRIs canonical.

      Behavioral Notes

      • This method should modify the input IRIRef in place and return it, to enable method chaining.
      • It should delegate to built-in normalization logic in IRIRef, such as IRIRef.normalizeInPlace(NORMALIZATION).
      • An IllegalArgumentException should be thrown if normalization is unsafe or invalid, such as attempting path normalization on a relative IRI â€” see RFC 3987, Section 5.3.2.4.

      Example Implementation

      
 public IRIRef normalize(IRIRef iriref) {
     return iriref
         .normalizeInPlace(NORMALIZATION.SYNTAX)
         .normalizeInPlace(NORMALIZATION.SCHEME);
 }
      Parameters:
      iriref - the IRIRef to normalize
      Returns:
      the normalized IRIRef (same instance, modified in place)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input cannot be safely normalized
